name: Traders Hotel Penang

reviews.text: This was our 2nd visit to Traders in Penang and we are definitely glad we came back :)
reviews.title: As good as last year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a room on the Club floor, which was spacious, clean and very comfortable.
reviews.title: A luxurious and comfortable hotel

reviews.text: The staff in the Club Lounge are very helpful and friendly and even remembered us from last year.
reviews.title: Great hotel - nice breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside I have found with the hotel, is the pool area. There is a bar/snack area but we have never seen it open, which seems a shame as during our stay there were quite a few people using the pool area on a daily basis. The swimming pool is nice in itself, but I would like to see more effort put into the area.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel in strange surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this partly because of its location, so near the heritage site (and many excellent eateries in town), and its provision of free parking. However, the hotel also turned out to be pretty luxurious, with very well-appointed bedrooms, excellent service, a good breakfast spread and a lovely pool. We could only do so much tourism over our 3 night stay in Georgetown and we'd be very tempted to come back another year for more, in which case we'd happily stay at the Trader's again.
reviews.title: Great rooms and service, location so-so
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in a Club room for four nights in mid July. The Club rooms aren't huge but are well equipped and very comfortable with good views, Club rooms located on the top three floors.

reviews.title: Hotel with the best location to local food!
reviews.text: Reception is carried out in the foyer of the Club lounge on the 16th floor, it was fast and efficient. The Club Lounge is small but comfortable with a good range of drinks and snacks available. Free cocktails and canapes are served in the evening with the service being attentive and friendly, there was a good range of both alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks available.

reviews.title: A pleasent stay.
reviews.text: A light breakfast is served in the Club Lounge or you can eat at the Islander Restaurant on the ground floor which offers the usual full buffet breakfast at no extra cost.

reviews.title: Strategic location, especially for those keen to take the public bus around the island.
reviews.text: We found the usual Asian style quilt on our bed too hot and swapped it for the blanket provided in the wardrobe. To our very pleasant surprise we found the next day that the bed had been remade with a blanket and extra sheets to act as a bedspread, in addition the other furniture in the room had been totally rearranged to create more room and provide easier access to the two large suitcases we were traveling with, this was all done without any request from us.

reviews.title: Great value, gd location, not high-high end, but clean & comfortable.
reviews.text: Traders isn't in the heart of town but is next to the Komtar Centre where you can catch the free bus that goes around Georgetown and has good access to local food places..

reviews.title: Rooms are getting there in age. Pillows...
reviews.text: Rooms are getting there in age. Pillows smell like they have been over used, but the sheets are clean. Washroom tight and harder to move around, but clean.

reviews.title: Great location, Great deal
reviews.text: Service was quick and efficient, and free wifi was a bonus. Loved the free newspaper every morning.

reviews.title: Great location, if a little aged
reviews.text: this hotel turned out to be a great surprise. feels like a business hotel with all the amenities and customer service perks that come with that but got a great deal and it was extremely well located in georgetown. walkable to all the major sites in georgetown and a ton of shopping if thats what you are interested in. make sure to take advantage of the free reciprocal relationship with their sister beach hotels in batu ferringi. you get the best of both worlds - easy access to georgetown plus a free trip to a luxury beach resort.

reviews.title: Would surely comeback..
reviews.text: I spent a weekend at the Traders Hotel Penang on a short holiday. The hotel has great location - right in the heart of Georgetown, within walking distance to most of the attractions in the immediate vicinity.

reviews.title: Wonderfull Penang
reviews.text: The check in and check out is quite fast, and the hotel, while a little aged (looks like it hasn't been renovated since the 80s), is comfortable enough - everything in the room works, and the room itself was clean and comfortably furnished.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel
reviews.text: One would be hard pressed to find anything wrong with this establishment. It was courteous friendly staff from check-in to check-out. The room was a decent size though not huge but it had all the amenities...robes and slippers, iron and ironing board, tea and coffee facilities, mini bar, hairblower, free internet ..etc...

reviews.title: Comfy beds, good location...
reviews.text: The bed was firm but not rock hard and we had a most comfortable sleep with an airconditioning system that could be adjusted to suit our preferences(cold).

reviews.title: Stayed in a standard room with a lovely...
reviews.text: Next door to a shopping mall which is very convenient.

reviews.title: Value For Money. Excellent Breakfast!
reviews.text: Looks a little dated from the outside, but once inside, provides ample relief from the scorching penang sun.

reviews.title: A good hotel in the old Georgetown
reviews.text: Nice lap pool on the 4th floor, clean and uncrowded.

This is pretty much one of the few popular hotels chosen by tourists/visitors, mainly for it's location being central in Georgetown. very close to Komtar and next to Perangin Mall. Rated as a 5-star hotel, it definitely provides a 5-star service and your usual full run of the mill amenities. It falls behind a bit with its rooms and common areas starting to show its age compared to say the G-Hotel with spanking new modern décor. Otherwise, they're pretty much very clean and maintained well. Facilities like free internet, business centre, gym/pool/sauna, free parking are inclusive. Buffet breakfast was well within the standards of a top hotel. Minor quibble is that I found their pillows a bit lumpy/soft for my liking, though extra pillows were provided in the room. I stayed over the Christmas period, and thought the hotel seemed fully booked, they were happy enough for a very late check out. The room was complimentary, so I'm not sure how much the normal rates would be. Overall, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Good location, good hotel but slightly dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - terrific if you want to take a train in from airport (40 mins by # 401/401E) or to travel around Penang b/c this hotel is RIGHT behind the KOMTAR station on intersection on Jalan Ria & Magazine Road. Service is great, and room was great - clean with all the amenities. This is a modern & efficient hotel. My only concern was that the decor was dated in furniture and appearance. The wood grain of the furnishings are starting to chip and fade but for a few nights, it is perfectly livable, although it should be updated. A 10 minute walk to historic Georgetown and food is everywhere outside.
reviews.title: Great location & price, though a little dated.

reviews.text: We booked the hotel for a 3 night stay over the Xmas period based on reviews of both this site and Expedia (where it features as a Insiders rated hotel with a 4.1/5 score).
reviews.title: Mixed reactions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having visited the Traders in KL prior I had a certain expectation of the Traders sub brand of Shangri La , that being of very modern, mid range cotemporary hotels. On walking into this Traders its very clear that this is a very old property with very 70/'s80's style decor/appearance. It has not been refurbished probably since it was built and therefore "very oldy worldy". Very dark wooods, beige colours, old fashioned lighting, light switches etc.
reviews.title: dont stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room size was rather small - we struggled to find space for our 2 suitcases, so if you like large'ish rooms(especially if you are staying on a premium floor) you may be dissapointed.
reviews.title: A great central location – but in need of a little TLC

reviews.text: Trader’s is a very quiet & clean hotel. The rooms are nice & there is a pool, fitness center & business center. Because we were not familiar with the area, we added breakfast to our room rate. Next time we will skip breakfast at the hotel & walk around the corner to Starbucks! The staff was very friendly & will help you plan your sightseeing. We hired a car for ½ day & it was well worth it! Just give them a list of what you want to see & they’ll take you. There is also a free shuttle bus to their sister hotel located at the beach.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a few nights on a leisure trip and was pleasantly surprised. Very nicely presented and good sized rooms. A little worn but nothing to get upset about. Very clean. Staff friendly enough, check-in and check-out very smooth. Location is good, right next door to one of the major shopping centres. There are not a lot of restaurants immediately close to the hotel that are open at night, but a short walk further into town and there are lots of options. Definitely not for you if you are looking for a resort type stay but if you are looking for something decent near the centre of Georgetown this is a recommended option.
reviews.title: Good for this price and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel cannot hide its mother company Shangri-La. Everything is good, rooms are very clean, there is a pool available, happy hour in the hotel lobby, service oriented people, free wifi etc. The breakfast was however not more than ok. And the famous Lubok Culja street is about 10 minute walk away
reviews.title: Recommendable for a Georgetown stay
Perfectly comfortable
reviews.text: In a nutshell: it is like described in many reviews. Good hotel - right next to Gurney Plaza.
We had an standard room with free internet, breakfast. Staff were very friendly. If we wanted to stay in Georgetown, then this is the place we'd be back to.
reviews.title: "Great Stay"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Is a classic a little bit old fashion hotel (you won't find fancy LED mood light, metal & crystal) but is a practical choice if you are in Penang for business, you are preferring the city stay rather than a beach hotel and you are not looking for surprises.
reviews.title: classic elegance, business oriented

reviews.text: Breakfast has a vast selection, with noodle station and omelette station.. and, for who loves it, even french cheese (at this latitudes is not so common).. but after all Penang is famous for food..
reviews.title: Convinient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is run by changri La so it is your warranty.. it has a gym, an external swimming pool, a sauna and a steam room.. and even a mini golf course on the restaurant. If you have kids i would suggest a beach hotel instead. Hotel is good value for money, like almost anything in Penang..
reviews.title: Centrally located, good value, great management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has a SPA/massage facility also, but i saw better ones, at least is practical to have it at hand if you need it.. and is not expensive.
reviews.title: Good hotel and location

reviews.text: Nice hotel, good rooms & service. The hotel is right next to the main bus deopt - Komtar. From there we had easy access to any part of the city by bus, may it be the old city of Georgetown or Batu Feringi Beach. The rooms are also spacious & clean and the service is also very good.
reviews.title: Good spot weary of their booking system

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Trader's Penang hotel is an excellent value for money option for travelers to Penang, especially those wanting to save some money. The negative criticisms of this place on the forum I think are a little harsh. The recommended options by many i.e G Hotel are anything from 100 to 150 Rm dearer a night!
reviews.title: Excellent value for Money
Beautiful atmosphere, great location
reviews.text: My recommendation is this hotel is good for those who wish tos ave some money but get a little bit better than your basic 3 star or 4 star hotel. The positives.. It is smack in the middle of the action, a 1 minute walk to the Komtar bus station which will get you on an excellent bus to anywhere in penang for $1 or so. Only 2.7 Rm to Batu Ferrenghi and takes app 30 - 40 mins. We used the local bus to get to BF rather than the shuttle. Cost only $1 each way each and you could come and go as you please rather than use the infrequent shuttle bus - and only took a few mins more!
There are several malls within 5 mins walk for the shoppers or get the bus to the others such as Guerney.
reviews.title: Two words - utter disaster.

reviews.text: The hotels is starting to show its age and probably needs a refit but everything is reasonably well maintained and clean! Our room was on the traders Floor. Smallish room, comfortable bed and pillow, old style flat screen tv (not LCD!) excellent view, bathroom just satisfactory. Plenty good enough for two people and at $110 a night pre ooked a bargain. The traders club floor at very little additionals cost gives you acces to the Lounge, two hours of evening drinks and snacks each night and a very pleasnan area to have breakfast. You also get access to teh Golden sands at BF. This is a nice 4 star hotel on the beach. Very clean but cluttered pool area with lots of deck chirs etc. The cost of this hotel is over double a Traders Room!. It is well worth visiting at least once though. Tip is use the local bus to get there as its stops straight outside. The adequate pool at the traders is ok for a dip. Excellent water quality and nice and warm but just basic concrete surroundings.
reviews.title: great staff

reviews.text: We had no issues with staff or hassles at all. So when you consider the cost and know what you are getting - an older but adequate Traders experience I think it is very good value for money for a Penang City area hotel.
reviews.title: Don't bother...

reviews.text: I have stayed several times already in the Traders Penang and it's almost like coming home when arriving in the lobby. Although maybe not very attractive from the outside, it's a real Pearl on the inside! Great staff, luxurous rooms, central location in walking distance to the old town, very good food and exceptional service. It's recommendable to pay for a Traders Club room, which includes access to the Traders Lounge, an ideal place for having a snack and a cold beverage before going out in the hot, tropical weather. They also have a small meeting room there and business facilities, which turns out very useful when you have to prepare a business meeting with your colleagues from overseas. If you have additional spare time, don't miss taking the bus to the beach resort and have dinner there. Magnificent!
reviews.title: Coming home...

reviews.text: Check in by a rather unwelcoming front desk lady. Not welcoming at all and looked distracted. Remainder of the stay the staff was very friendly. I was meeting a friend i had not seen for a couple of years and we were going to catch up. There was no way we could have drinks at the lounge because of the singing that was going on. I think they could make a lot more money if it was quiet or just back ground music so people could talk or had a better band singing. She was on the club floor, so we went to the club lounge. Mark (who was on duty) was great. Very accommodating and got us drinks from the lounge downstairs sent up. He offered us the conference room so we had some privacy to laugh and catch up. Rooms were comfortable. The free internet is great. Shuttle bus to the Shangri la hotel for the beach is great. They also offer free shuttle to the free trade zones, so it is very business friendly. Extremely poor selection of TV channels. Well stocked bathroom. Extensive buffet breakfast. Good location right in town.
reviews.title: Good value hotel that caters to business and leisure guest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Traders, Penang. We have stayed at many hotels around the the region and this would be one of the best. Why, from the time of arrival and during our stay we were warmly greeted at all times. The room was very comfortable and the hosuekeeping was impressive. We would have a leisurely breakfast and our room would be made up on our return and we could relax and plan our day without the clutter. The breaksfast choice was very good and the staff were freindly and helpful. We chose the 'Traders cluc' option and this was a great choice and value. We could explore the city and island and come back and have complimentary drinks and food after a 'hot' and long day'. We also good have breakfast in the club longe or the main breakfast dining room. We chose the hotel location so as to explore Georgetown rather than spend all the time at the beach and have to travel back into town. The hotel had a free bus service to their assoicate hotel so we were able to spend time at the beach at our discretion. A great option!. We recommend this hotel and we wil be back...
reviews.title: Excellent stay, Ecellent staff, Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid extra to stay in the Traders Club. This gave us access to the Taders Lounge where breakfast, snacks tea coffee juice thru out the day, & drinks & snacks from 6 to 8 pm (but the snacks were generous enough to serve as dinner). Check in & out were also in the club. The service was exceptional - the friendliest I've ever experienced.
reviews.title: Traders Club is great value

reviews.text: The room was standard hotel but included a 2 seater lounge. Internet access & the New Straits Times were free.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: Arrived at Traders in the evening and all my requests have been met. I got a smoking room on the high floor however room was very small and smelled mould - far away from advertised 28 sq m. I complained in a middle of the night and was given slighly bigger corner room which was quite adequate. It was on a non smoking floor as only 2 floors.
reviews.title: mixed feeling ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is very good, particualrly housemaid and room service. Reception staff while accurate and speedy seem to do their job like being programmed robots. None of the staff smiles to the customer, didnt have much to do with a concierge staff but they seem to look the other way with no greetings towards the guests whatsovever,
reviews.title: A little tired but good value

reviews.text: Buffet lunch with excellent variety (45 RMB) however breakfast is not variety nor value for western guest unless one like congi or springrolls for breakfast. Was offered breakfast at the lower rate when checking in but its not worth even the reduce price.
reviews.title: descent deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summation, hotel is a reasonably cheap but guess for price (220 RMB) one can find better deal, particlarly location is not that good and its far away from everything.
reviews.title: good value
horrible attitude from front desk staff
reviews.text: There is a free internet and free shuttle bus 4 times a day to the sister property at the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights after visiting KL Traders and this is not to be compared to in any way. The hotel in Penang is much older and aimed more at business travellers.
reviews.title: A comfortable hotel in Georgetown.

reviews.text: However, we had a very comfortable stay - our room was well equipped and roomy, the pool was nice and quiet and a good place to relax and the club lounge was super.
reviews.title: Dated and unimpressive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff in the club lounge were very helpful and friendly. The porters were also extremely efficient and aided us with our sightseeing visits around Penang.
reviews.title: Loved it, club room highly recommended

reviews.text: We were a little let down by the breakfast though, the staff seemed to be a little preoccupied and my husband was charged extra for camomile tea which he requested as he is allergic to caffeine. The selection was good, but alot of the buffet hot food did not taste very fresh.
reviews.title: Useful location

reviews.text: A good stay overall though and we would stay here again if in Penang.
reviews.title: Once initial problems were sorted, - enjoyable stay, excellent dinner buffets, convenient location.

reviews.text: As befits it's 5 star business rating, the Traders Hotel provides professional service with a smile. The standard rooms and ensuite are a bit smaller than the Bayview but the overall presentation of the Traders Hotel is superior.
reviews.title: Vey professional

reviews.text: This is a business orientated hotel, but the discounted weekend packages make it worthwhile changing hotels in Penang just for the experience. The food and drink service is top quality and is priced accordingly. There is a good pool and gym.
reviews.title: Aged, but gracefully...

reviews.text: The Traders Hotel is located next to the Komtar business centre and bus station and the Prangin shopping mall but there is not much else in easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - great staff

reviews.text: The big plus for tourists is the Traders free shuttle to its sister hotels in Batu Ferringhi where you can spend a very pleasant day at the Golden Sands and use of those facilities
reviews.title: Enjoyed the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short business trip turned into a fantastic 18 hour treat for me, never ever expected that I would love Penang so much! I was under the impression that all of Malaysia had been renovated and ‘cleaned-up’ beyond help, but Georgetown is indeed the ‘real’ Asia; a living town, with a feel and flavour that is absolutely unmatched.
reviews.title: Great hotel with lousy location

description: Shangri-La Hotel, Penang is located in the heart of Georgetown. Apart from being Penang's premier business hotel, Shangri-La Hotel is also its main convention center, supported by superb meeting facilities, state-of-the-art audio/visual equipment, a modern business center and a fully-equipped fitness center. Its rooms and suites offer a complete range of amenities one would expect from a 5-star deluxe hotel. Dining is superb, with master chefs serving up authentic Cantonese and Continental cuisine.
